definition: to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
Dream Pool Essays by Shen Kuo 沈括[Shen3 Kuo4], book on various fields of knowledge, the first to describe the magnetic needle compass

sentences.english: Even in their own palaces they write to each other.
sentences.chinese: 即使在他们自己的寝宫里，他们也用笔谈。

sentences.english: On the threshhold of a new century, this paper gives a review and a forward look of contemporary Chinese literature (CCL) studies.
sentences.chinese: 这是世纪之交对中国现代文学研究回顾和展望的笔谈。

sentences.english: Commentary on the Research of the Beginning of Modern Chinese Literature;
sentences.chinese: 这是世纪之交对中国现代文学研究回顾和展望的笔谈。

sentences.english: Collected here are papers of 15 of the participants.
sentences.chinese: 这里发表的是15位与会学者的笔谈。

definition: notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
to talk with sb (face to face)/discussion/talk/chat
to compose (a piece of writing)/to write/(written) work/writer
author's preface/autobiographical notes as introduction to a book
my unworthy manuscript (humble expr.)/my humble writing
preface/foreword/preamble/recital (law)/also written 敘文|叙文[xu4 wen2]
